2020-08-30 • Machine Learning

Principle Component Analysis Tutorial

Unsupervised Dimentionality Reduction

via Principle Component Analysis
In the context of dimensionality reduction, feature extraction can be understood as an approach to data compression with the goal of maintaining most of the relevant information.
Feature extraction is not only used to improve storage space or the computational efficiency of the learning algorithm, but can also improve the predictive performance by reducing the curse of dimensionalityâ€”especially if we are working with non-regularized models.

x1,x2 are original feature axes, pc1,pc2 are the principle components.
